intro: Passerina brunioides, commonly known as the brunioides spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its unique floral structures known as cyathia. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in cup-like formations. The leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly hairy texture.
